alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 7:59PM EST until November 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. .Heavy rainfall totaling 2-4 inches across Transylvania County has caused the upper French Broad River to exceed bankfull from Rosman to Blantyre, causing common, nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying areas including farmland, boat-access areas, low-water crossings, and a few secondary roads. The river is expected to crest Saturday morning below Minor Flood Stage and recede below bankfull later Saturday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. Most farm fields are flooding between the French Broad River and Brevard Rd and between the French Broad River and Pleasant Grove Rd. Flooding of a few secondary roads, including Wilson Rd, Island Ford Rd, Green Rd, and Hannah Ford Rd is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 14.5 feet and rising slowly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 15.5 feet tomorrow morning. - Action/Advisory Stage is 15.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
